answers.answer: Hi Kelly,How are you feeling now?Did you have any trauma to the foot?Has any cardiologist evaluated you to rule out any Aneurysm (Abdominal Aorta).Diabetes or prediabetes can cause nerve injury, leading to severe pain in foot.I think you should take a review opinion from a neurologist to search for a cause.You can start on combination of analgesics like NSAID'S plus Opoid analgesics.Alternatively you can also consult pain management specialist.Hope this helps you.Bye.

question: am having severe pain in the tops of both feet and the balls of my feet.  I thought it was because of wearig ill fitting shoes to a Wedding but this has been going on since 5 weeks now.  I saw a podiatrist and a neurologist and an internist and they are all baffled because the pain is so symetrical.  I am taking pain medicine and they have me on some patches that numb the feet but still no answers.  They ran my blood work and all seems fine.  It seems to have flared up overnight and I am having a hard time sleeping even with the pain pills.  I'm really started to get depressed and am worried sick.  Can anyone help me?  I have been under tremendous stress but would that present as pain in both feet at exactly the same place?  Also, my tongue is a bit numb can barely taste food.  This may be completely unrelated.  I'm mostly concerned with the painful feet.  It is excruciating.  Thank you.
title: Intense pain in both feet symetrical
